page.title: 03THE VILLAGE OF HATT
page.content: This village has grown from nothing. The land was purchased by a speculator who has developed it for housing over the last twenty years.Future plans are delayed by a sewage embargo. Hatt is populated by retired people and commuters,the latter working in the Navy or Devonport Dockyard. The only shop is a Post Office selling stationery and limited foodstuffs.The garage on the A388 has an Austin/Rover franchise and sells petrol and does repairs. Most children aged 5-11 go to Landulph School while those aged 11+ travel by bus to Saltash or Callington Comprehensives.
